meanings.definition: To tilt or turn up at an angle.
meanings.sent1: She cockbills her head to get a better view of the stage.
meanings.sent2: The painter cockbills the canvas to add depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy cockbills its head in confusion, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sun slowly cockbills over the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: The old tree in the yard seems to cockbills its branches towards the sunlight every morning.

meanings.definition: The projecting part of a ship's anchor that is secured to the cathead.
meanings.sent1: The sailor carefully secured the cockbills of the anchor to the ship.
meanings.sent2: The rusty cockbills of the anchor clanked against the metal of the ship.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the cockbills of the anchor, looking for scraps.
meanings.sent4: The cockbills of the anchor reached out like fingers into the deep blue sea.
meanings.sent5: The captain always checked the cockbills of the anchor before setting sail to ensure a safe journey.
